title: Establishes the crime of unlawful purchase or sale of a social security number
summary: Establishes the crimes of unlawful purchase or sale of a social security number in the first and second degrees; prohibits the sale of a person's social security account number; establishes unlawful purchase or sale of a social security number in the first degree as a class D felony and unlawful purchase or sale of a social security number in the second degree as a class E felony.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1204

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. KOLB, REILICH, FINCH, REILLY, OAKS -- Multi-Spon-
         sored  by  --  M.  of A.   AMEDORE, BARCLAY, BURLING, BUTLER, CALHOUN,
         COLTON,  CONTE,  CROUCH,  DUPREY,  GIGLIO,  HAWLEY,  HAYES,  JEFFRIES,
         JORDAN,  P. LOPEZ,  MAYERSOHN, McDONOUGH, McKEVITT, MOLINARO, RABBITT,
         RAIA, SALADINO, SAYWARD -- read once and referred to the Committee  on
         Codes

       AN  ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to establishing the crime of
         unlawful purchase or sale of a social security account number

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The penal law is amended by adding two new sections 190.87
    2  and 190.88 to read as follows:
    3  S 190.87 UNLAWFUL PURCHASE OR SALE OF A SOCIAL SECURITY  ACCOUNT  NUMBER
    4             IN THE SECOND DEGREE.
    5    A  PERSON  IS GUILTY OF UNLAWFUL PURCHASE OR SALE OF A SOCIAL SECURITY
    6  ACCOUNT NUMBER IN THE SECOND DEGREE WHEN HE OR SHE SELLS  OR  OFFERS  TO
    7  SELL  OR  HE  OR  SHE  PURCHASES  OR OFFERS TO PURCHASE ANOTHER PERSON'S
    8  SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBER AND:
    9    1. HE OR SHE KNOWS OR REASONABLY SHOULD KNOW THAT SUCH ACCOUNT  NUMBER
   10  IS INTENDED TO BE USED TO DEFRAUD, DECEIVE OR INJURE ANOTHER; OR
   11    2.  HE  OR  SHE  KNOWS  OR REASONABLY SHOULD KNOW THAT THE USE OF SUCH
   12  ACCOUNT NUMBER WOULD CONSTITUTE A VIOLATION OF THIS CHAPTER.
   13    UNLAWFUL PURCHASE OR SALE OF A SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBER  IN  THE
   14  SECOND DEGREE IS A CLASS E FELONY.
   15  S 190.88 UNLAWFUL  PURCHASE  OR SALE OF A SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBER
   16             IN THE FIRST DEGREE.
   17    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF UNLAWFUL PURCHASE OR SALE OF A  SOCIAL  SECURITY
   18  ACCOUNT NUMBER IN THE FIRST DEGREE WHEN:
   19    1.  HE  OR  SHE  COMMITS  THE  CRIME OF UNLAWFUL PURCHASE OR SALE OF A
   20  SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBER IN THE SECOND DEGREE; AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00668-02-1

       A. 1204                             2

    1    (A) HE OR SHE HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY CONVICTED WITHIN THE LAST FIVE YEARS
    2  OF UNLAWFUL PURCHASE OR SALE OF A SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBER IN  THE
    3  SECOND DEGREE AS DEFINED IN SECTION 190.87 OF THIS ARTICLE; OR
    4    (B) HE OR SHE KNOWINGLY SELLS OR OFFERS TO SELL OR PURCHASES OR OFFERS
    5  TO PURCHASE FIFTY OR MORE PERSONS' SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBERS; OR
    6    2.  WITH INTENT TO FURTHER THE COMMISSION OF UNLAWFUL PURCHASE OR SALE
    7  OF A SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBER IN THE  SECOND  DEGREE,  HE  OR  SHE
    8  SUPERVISES MORE THAN THREE ACCOMPLICES.
    9    UNLAWFUL  PURCHASE  OR SALE OF A SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT NUMBER IN THE
   10  FIRST DEGREE IS A CLASS D FELONY.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   12  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to establishing the crime of unlawful purchase or sale of a social security account number
